title: Outreach, Client Education, and Coordination

outreach_plan.requirement: Each LAA must have a documented Outreach Plan to ensure enough eligible applications to meet production goals. Outreach must prioritize the elderly, disabled, households with young children, and LIHEAP households.
core_activities: Coordinate with community organizations to identify eligible households.
Promote IHWAP benefits via flyers, community events, senior services, disability support groups, nutrition programs, and local agencies.
Update and distribute a directory of services including energy, social, and health programs.
referral_system: Maintain an updated system to refer clients to all available energy assistance and social service programs.
Make referrals for services such as LIHEAP, SNAP, Circuit Breaker tax relief, senior services, SSI, Head Start, nutrition, child abuse hotline, and more.
Document referrals and coordinate follow-up as needed.

client_health_and_safety_education.timing: Provide at both application and assessment/energy audit.
core_requirements: Discuss any identified or suspected health & safety hazards with the client during assessment (lead, mold, moisture, asbestos, etc.).
Deliver required EPA publications: Lead Booklet (Renovate Right), A Brief Guide to Mold, Moisture, and Your Home, and A Citizen’s Guide to Radon.
If continuous ventilation is likely to be installed, also provide 'Ventilation for You & Your Home' brochure.
Ensure Applicant Health and Safety Intake Questionnaire is completed at application in IWx.
At assessment, confirm delivery of education materials and attach photo evidence in IWx.
If publications are not on hand, print from OCA extranet or federal sources.
hazard_notification: If any immediate or potential risk is found, provide a Hazardous Conditions Notification Form listing the hazards and deliver a copy to the client and/or landlord.
Conditions triggering notification include (but are not limited to): asbestos, vermiculite, biological hazards, raw sewage, structural collapse, severe moisture/mold, lead, unsafe wiring, and more.
Discuss risks and precautions for identified hazards (asbestos siding, vermiculite, etc.).
additional_materials: Safe Pest Control, Seven Tips to Keeping a Healthy Home, and other HUD/EPA guides as appropriate

resources.title: A Brief Guide to Mold, Moisture, and Your Home
Lead Safe Certified Guide to Renovate Right
Seven Tips to Keeping a Healthy Home

documentation_and_photos: At assessment, take a color photo of delivered education materials at the client’s home and attach in IWx.
Maintain a signed Client Education Materials Checklist in the file.
For all hazardous conditions, retain a copy of the signed Hazardous Conditions Notification.
reference_policy: IHWAP Operations Manual (PY2026) – Section III Outreach and Client Education
